contentrichtext.text: {{Hiero|The Season of the<br> Harvest – Smw|<hiero>N37:mw-hrw-.- or -.-N37:,:N36-t:N5</hiero>|align=right|era=default}} The '''Season of the Harvest''' (known in [[Egyptian language|Egyptian]] as '''Shemu''' or '''Shomu''' - [[Manuel de Codage|transliterated]] as Smw) is the third and final season of the [[Egyptian calendar]]. The word Shemu literally translates as "low-water", and falls roughly between early May and early September. During this season, the crops of the grain harvest are collected.<ref>David P. Silverman, Ancient Egypt, Duncan Baird Publishers, London 1997. p.93</ref> '''Shemu''' is preceded by the [[Season of the Emergence]] ('''Proyet'''), and is followed by the [[Season of the Inundation]] ('''Akhet'''). During '''Shemu''', the Egyptian farmers would harvest their crops - in clear contrast to the practice of their contemporaries in the ancient world, who would be just beginning to plant their crops at this time of the year. '''Shemu''' is also known as the '''Summer Season''' or the '''Dry Season'''<ref>[http://www.let.leidenuniv.nl/saqqara/Egyptology/Glossary/Inundation.html Leiden University]</ref> and is occasionally written as '''Shomu'''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.britannica.com/eb/topic-541508/shomu |title=shomu |publisher=Britannica |date= |accessdate=2012-03-14}}</ref> The ancient [[Egyptians]] used this name in both their lunar and their civil calendars. The months of the lunar calendar are roughly equivalent to the period from early May to the heliacal rising of [[Sirius]] around the beginning of September. Since the civil calendar moved through the seasons over time, losing about one day every four years, this season does not continuously match any part of the modern calendar. ==Months== The Season of Harvest consists of four 30-day months plus one little month of 5 or 6 days. This little month was considered to be an intercalary period, which brought the season of 365 days. These months can be either referred to by number (months 9 through 13) or by names as follows: * Month 9 = [[Pashons]] * Month 10 = [[Paoni]] * Month 11 = [[Epip]] * Month 12 = [[Mesori]] * Month 13 = [[Pi Kogi Enavot]] (the little month) The Season of Harvest is preceded by the [[Season of the Emergence]] and is followed by the [[Season of the Inundation]].<ref>Marshall Clagett, ''Ancient Egyptian Science: A Source Book'', Diane 1989, ISBN 0-87169-214-7, p.5</ref> ==See also== *[[Coptic calendar]] *[[Egyptian calendar]] *[[Temple of Kom Ombo]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{S-start}} {{succession box| before=[[Season of the Emergence]] <br>''Proyet''| title=''[[Egyptian calendar|Egyptian Seasons]]''<br> Season of the Harvest <br>'''''Shemu'''''| years=days: 125 or 126 days| after=[[Season of the Inundation]] <br>''Akhet''}} {{S-end}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Season Of The Harvest}} [[Category:Ancient Egyptian calendar]] {{Ancient-Egypt-stub}}
